title: NixOS Package PRs for konsole, plasma-pa, nixos, nixos-generate, iproute2, openssh packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for konsole, plasma-pa, nixos, nixos-generate, iproute2, openssh packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Previously, the iprout2 module used import from derivation for the rt_tables configuration. By using a slim derivation and symlinks instead, this is no longer the case.

items.title: nixos/iproute2: Remove import from derivation

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This implementation is partly based on #189099 and home-manager's dconf implementation and addresses some related reviews. A main difference between this and #189099 is that this implementation is completely backward-compatible and has lockdown support.

Example:

with lib.gvariant;
{
  enable = true;
  profiles.user.databases = [
    {
      settings = {
        com.raggesilver.BlackBox = {
          opacity = mkUint32 100;
          theme-dark = "Tommorow Night";
          scrollback-lines = mkUint32 10000;
        };
      };
      locks = {
        com.raggesilver.BlackBox = {
          theme-dark = false;
        };
      };
      lockSubpaths = {
        com.raggesilver.BlackBox = true;
      };
    }
  ];
}

items.title: nixos/dconf: support generating from attrs

items.content_html:
Description of changes

When I first tried running nixos-generate-config on my NixOS install I bumped into this error. I did not think to try as root so I decided to Google the issue.

It seems that I wasn't the only one unsure of how to fix it. There was a post on reddit asking my question. https://www.reddit.com/r/NixOS/comments/yv44zx/comment/iwr7n85/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button

I hope that this improved error will reduce potential confusion.

Things done

N/A: this is not a change to a package
items.title: nixos-generate-config: Add help message when `btrfs subvol` fails for non root user

items.content_html:
Description of changes

As part of a desire to help stabilize flakes, I've made nixos-generate-config create a flake.nix which simply imports the configuration.nix that is already generated as part of nixos-generate-config

The flake.nix looks like this

{
  outputs = { self, nixpkgs }: {
    nixosConfigurations.nixos = nixpkgs.lib.nixosSystem {
      modules = [
        ./configuration.nix
      ];
    };
  };
}

The system is already defined in hardware-configuration.nix, and I attempted many times to find ways to generate the inputs attribute set, containing nixpkgs. However, it seems too brittle to attempt to generate the inputs from nix-instantiate --impure --eval --expr '(import <nixpkgs> {}).lib.trivial.release', since this can return 22.11, which would not be a branch/release that would not exist on Github for NixOS depending on the time of running the script. So I've left the decision up to the nix registry to resolve, by omitting the inputs attribute.

Things done

items.title: nixos/grub: generate BLS entries

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos-rebuild repl, which loads a nix repl for you.

If you use flakes, brings the flake itself into scope as well.

Apologies to the non-flake users; your repl isn't quite as fancy, but at least evaluates your config exactly as you would expect, unlike flakes which are only evaluated impurely for now.

Tested by hand, as evaluating in the sandbox is tricky.

Try it

Flake in ~/config

nix run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl --flake ~/config

Non-flake

nix --extra-experimental-features flakes\ nix-command run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This module ensures that we have a monado.service that has CAP_SYS_NICE to utilize asynchronous reprojection. (See #217119) for details about asynchronous reprojection)

This effectively shadows the unit files packaged in monado. Maybe it is desirable to remove those from the packages.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This adds a NixOS module for Soft Serve, a tasty, self-hostable Git server for the command line.

The module has a test that checks some basic things like creating users, creating a repo and cloning it. Bash is required for running the hook scripts (e.g., on push), so I added it to the path of the wrapper.

items.title: nixos/soft-serve: init

items.content_html:
WIP PR to deal with openssh settings.

not needed now that they can be set via services.openssh.settings. If you only set services.openssh.AuthorizedKeysCommand without its AuthorizedKeysCommandUser counterpart (the user under which to run services.openssh.settings.AuthorizedKeysCommand), the sshd config validation will fail. The previous default was "nobody" so if you haven't deviated from it the migration path would be

services.openssh.settings.AuthorizedKeysCommandUser = "nobody" if not set else or services.openssh.settings.authorizedKeysCommandUser.

Description of changes

items.title: nixos/nginx: add more compressMimeTypes

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This is a NixOS module to enable "multiple bootloaders" at the same time.

They all will be installed one by one in the reverse order as they are specified to let users append new bootloaders from multiple locations.

The motivation is to build newer usecases for boot stories in NixOS.

TODO:

  • Assert there must be at least one bootloader enabled or container boot is enabled.
  • More asserts!
  • Add documentation on how to add a new bootloader in NixOS.
  • Ensure no "false positives" deprecation notices appears due to poking the structure.
  • Deprecate boot.loader.efi into boot.efi
  • Ensure containers works.

items.title: nixos/croodle: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

From openssh's perspective, the AllowUsers, DenyUsers, AllowGroups and DenyGroups settings are space-separated lists of user-/groupnames, thus treat them the same here.

This allows them to be set like services.openssh.settings.AllowUsers = [ "foo" "bar" ] and be merged automatically.

[ Not sure if this is considered a breaking change, since the freefrom services.openssh.settings option is not yet part of any stable release. If it is, please let me know and I add a release notes entry as appropriate! ]

    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/unpackerr: init

items.content_html:
This does not add anything to the NixOS manual intentionally.
I intend to tackle that in #241871.

Co-authored-by: Alejandro Sanchez Medina alejandrosanchzmedina@gmail.com
items.title: nixpkgs/NixOS manuals: devmode feature
